Package cards

Class CareerCard

java.lang.Object
cards.Card
cards.CareerCard
All Implemented Interfaces:
MachineRandom
Direct Known Subclasses:
Accountant, Athlete, ComputerConsultant, Doctor, Lawyer, RacecarDriver, Server
public abstract class CareerCard
extends Card
implements MachineRandom
Abstract class providing a skeletal implementation of a career card, which dictates the player's career, degree requirement (whether it is required or not), and maximum number of pay raises

A career card is picked alongside a salary card at the start of the game and when the player lands on a magenta space with instruction "College Career Choice" or "Job Search."

  • Constructor Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • CareerCard

      public CareerCard​(java.lang.String name, boolean isDegreeRequired, int maxNumPayRaisesLB, int maxNumPayRaisesUB)
      Constructor with the specified name of this card, degree requirement (whether it is required or not), and lower and upper bounds for the maximum number of pay raises that a player can have as parameters

      The name of a career card is indicative of the career it specifies (Lawyer, Accountant, etc.).

      Parameters:
      name - name of this card
      isDegreeRequired - set to true if the career requires a college degree; false, otherwise
      maxNumPayRaisesLB - lower bound for the maximum number of pay raises that a player can have
      maxNumPayRaisesUB - upper bound for the maximum number of pay raises that a player can have

  • Method Details

    • getIsDegreeRequired

      public boolean getIsDegreeRequired()
      Returns true if the career requires a college degree; false, otherwise
      Returns:
      true if the career requires a college degree; false, otherwise

    • getMachineRandNum

      public int getMachineRandNum()
      Returns a randomly generated value within the lower and upper bounds for the maximum number of pay raises (inclusive) using the Java utility class ThreadLocalRandom

      A separate (private) function sets the maximum number of pay raises indicated in this card to the returned randomly generated value.

      Technically, the number is generated in a pseudorandom fashion, which is adequate for the purposes of the game.

      Specified by:
      getMachineRandNum in interface MachineRandom
      Returns:
      Randomly generated value within the lower and upper bounds for the maximum number of pay raises (inclusive)

    • getInfo

      public java.lang.String getInfo()
      Returns the card description to be displayed on the console during the actual gameplay

      In particular, the card description contains the following details:

      • Type of card (Career Card)
      • Name of the card (actual career)
      • Degree requirement (whether a degree is required)
      • Maximum number of pay raises
      Specified by:
      getInfo in class Card
      Returns:
      card description to be displayed on the console during the actual gameplay

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this career card, which includes its name, degree requirement, and the range for and the actual maximum number of pay raises

      In particular, the representation contains the following details:

      • Type of card (Career Card)
      • Degree requirement (whether a degree is required)
      • Upper and lower bounds for the maximum number of pay raises
      • Maximum number of pay raises
      • Name of the card (actual career: for example, Lawyer, Accountant, etc.)
      Overrides:
      toString in class Card
      Returns:
      string representation of this career card, which includes its name, degree requirement, and the range for and the actual maximum number of pay raises

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object obj)
      Returns true if the names of two career cards are equal and false otherwise

      This method is used in the program to ensure that two career cards are unique.

      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      true if the names of two career cards are equal; false, otherwise
